intro: Eriosorus warscewiczii, commonly known as the hairy spleenwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, moss-like growth and the presence of small, hairy structures on its stems and leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as on rocks or tree trunks. Its leaves are usually narrowly elongated and have a distinct midrib. Eriosorus warscewiczii is often found in temperate regions and is an indicator of clean, humid conditions in its habitat.
